title: Fed Chair Powell Suggests When Interest Rates Cuts Will Be Appropriate
text: The Semiannual Monetary Policy Report is being made to Congress this week, and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell was testifying before the Committee on Financial Services in the U.S. House of Representatives on Wednesday, July 10.

title: Fed’s Powell says trade, slow growth ‘weigh’ on US economic outlook
text: Concerns about trade policy and a weak global economy “continue to weigh on the US economic outlook” and the Federal Reserve stands ready to “act as appropriate” to sustain a decade-long expansion, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell said on Wednesday in remarks that could bolster expectations of an interest rate cut later this month. In prepared.

title: Fed Chair Powell Signals Openness to Rate Cut and Stock Market Rallies
text: Jerome H. Powell told lawmakers that trade tensions and global economic issues continue to weigh on the United States economy.

title: Investors Focus on Powell's Testimony
text: In today’s pre-market, we look forward to a public speech by Federal Reserve Chair Jay Powell. Discussions will include, most prominently, whether or not the interest rate cut baked into the stock market currently — at a 100% chance — is warranted, or if there if some idea the Fed Chair looks to hold at 2.25-2.50%.

title: Stock Market Hits Record Highs On Fed Chair Powell's Dovish Comments
text: The Dow Jones industrials gained more than 100 points after Fed Chair Powell's dovish comments Wednesday. Amazon added to its recent breakout.

title: Fed-funds futures traders now see 16% chance of half-point cut by Fed in July
text: Fed-funds futures traders on Wednesday increased bets on a half-point cut in interest rates by the Federal Reserve at the end of the month, according to CME Group's FedWatch tool. Based on trading in the contracts, traders see a 16.3% chance the Fed cuts its official policy rate by 50 basis points on July 31, compared to just 3.3% on Tuesday.

title: All Eyes & Ears on Fed Chair Powell
text: Fed Chair Powell remains troubled by uncertainty over trade, global growth and unresolved issues with Brexit and the U.S. debt ceiling.

title: The Fed chief just told markets a rate cut is coming, now it's just a question of how big
text: Powell's dovish remarks, prepared for Congressional testimony, reaffirmed the Fed could cut interest rates in the near future.

title: Watch Fed Chair Jerome Powell testify to Congress as stocks rally, rates fall
text: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell testifies in front of the House Financial Services Committee on Wednesday.

title: Prepared Remarks From Fed Chair Seem To Point To Dovishness; Testimony Ahead
text: Fed Chair Jerome Powell kicks off two days of Congressional testimony, and the first hint—his prepared remarks—seemed to strike a dovish tone.

title: Fed chairman hints at first interest rate cut in over a decade
text: Officials believe weakening global economy and rising trade tensions strengthened the case for a rate cut, Jerome Powell wrote.

title: White House is likely to send USMCA trade deal to Congress after Sept. 1, sources say
text: The move would set up a vote on President Donald Trump's replacement for the North American Free Trade Agreement by the end of the year.

title: Wall Street opens higher after Powell's remarks boost rate cut hopes
text: U.S. stocks opened higher on Wednesday as hopes of an interest rate cut later this month were boosted by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell's comment that the central bank would "act as appropriate" to sustain record U.S. growth.

title: Stock rise at open Wednesday after Fed's Powell signals likely interest rate cut in testimony to Congress
text: U.S. stocks rose on opening Wednesday after Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell's planned testimony to Congress at 10.00 am Eastern indicated a likely interest rate cut later this month.

title: Fed Chief Powell Stays Dovish On Rate Cuts; Dow Jones Futures Gain
text: Fed chief Jerome Powell kept hope alive for multiple Fed rate cuts this year in testimony before Congress. Dow Jones futures turned higher.

title: Stock-index futures turn higher as Fed's Powell cites economic 'uncertainties'
text: Stock-index futures erased early losses to turn higher Wednesday after prepared testimony by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell emphasized uncertainty about the global economic outlook, reinforcing market expectations for a rate cut when policy makers meet at the end of the month. Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average  rose 44 points, or 0.2%, to 26,823, while S&P 500 futures  advanced 6.9 points, or 0.2%, to 2,989.

title: Stock Futures Sag Ahead Of Powell; T Mobile Stock To Join S&P 500
text:
JPMorgan, T-Mobile and Comcast rose and oil prices surged early Wednesday, but stock futures sagged as markets awaited testimony from Fed Chief Powell. 
The post Stock Futures Sag Ahead Of Powell; T Mobile Stock To Join S&P 500 appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Wall Street Wants Out of the US-China Trade War
text: US industry leaders in technology and healthcare have backed away from hiring in China amid the ongoing trade war. But Wall Street banks and financial services firms spent the first half of 2019 adding job postings in China - a signal business leaders are eager to put the policy spat behind them.

title: Bitcoin Tripled In The First Half Of 2019
text: Bitcoin prices rose significantly during the first half of 2019, propelled higher by a variety of factors. Will the digital currency reach fresh, all-time highs later this year?

title: Futures slip ahead of Powell's testimony
text: U.S. stock futures fell on Wednesday, as investors eyed Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell's remarks later in the day for clues on the central bank's interest rate policy direction.

title: Trump has reportedly tasked aides to find a way to weaken the US dollar
text: President Donald Trump has reportedly tasked aides to find a way to weaken the U.S. dollar in an effort to boost the economy.

title: Sir Kim Darroch quits as UK ambassador to US amid Trump memos row
text: Sir Kim Darroch has resigned as the UK's ambassador to the US amid a row over leaked memos that were critical of Donald Trump.

title: Euro zone growth, inflation outlook cut as risks from U.S. trade grow
text: The European Commission lowered its estimates on Wednesday for euro zone growth and inflation, saying uncertainty over U.S. trade policy posed a major risk to the bloc.

title: Oil gains on API stockdraw, Gulf of Mexico storm
text: Oil prices rose more than 2% on Wednesday after industry data showed U.S. inventories fell more than expected and as major U.S. producers evacuated rigs in the Gulf of Mexico before a storm.

title: Oil Jumps On Report Of Falling U.S. Stockpiles And Iran Tension
text: Oil jumped most in a week as an industry report showing a continued draw-down in U.S. crude inventories tightened a supply outlook by rising tension in East

title: US will allow licensed sales to Huawei, but it remains blacklisted     - CNET
text: Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross cleared up confusion following President Trump's June announcement.

title: The Federal Reserve Will Not Produce A Bull Market
text: Cutting interest rates is not the solution to the slow growth problem

title: US to relax Huawei ban, announces White House
text: The White House has announced it will relax sanctions on Huawei which prevented American firms from providing technologies to the company.

title: US Treasury yields drop after Powell says Fed will act 'as appropriate' and inflation remains muted
text: U.S. debt yields rose on Wednesday as Fed Chairman Jerome Powell neared the start of his two-day, biannual testimony on Capitol Hill.

title: The Commerce Department will accept applications from companies that want to supply Huawei, but it remains blacklisted
text: About two months after Huawei was placed on the Commerce Department’s Entity List, the Chinese telecom equipment and smartphone giant will be able to do business with American suppliers again–but only if they get a license from the U.S. government.

title: Corporate activist Elliott outspending rivals: Lazard data
text: Elliott Management Corp, Paul Singer's $35 billion hedge fund, has outspent all rivals in pushing for corporate changes like spin-offs, mergers, and management overhauls this year.
